text: the national media is descending on
Moore Oklahoma today one day after a
devastating tornado there killed an
unknown number of people and injured
hundreds of others the media is doing
basically the same thing it did in
Newtown Connecticut after a school
shooting there in december and as it did
in boston after a bombing there in april
those were crimes this is an act of
nature but all the stories are reminders
about the importance about the enduring
value of first responder reporters in
newtown it was the photographer for the
local newspaper who arrived first at
Sandy Hook Elementary who took that
unforgettable series of photos of
children being led out of the school
single file by a teacher in Boston it
was a web producer for the Boston Globe
who happened to be at the finish line of
the marathon shooting video when the
bombs went off in rapid succession his
video became the most memorable out of
many from the bombings that day outside
Oklahoma City on Monday it was the local
news helicopter pilots and camera men
who followed the tornado from start to
finish across the landscape basically
warning people in a way that no tornado
warning can as soon as the tornado
dissipated they turned their helicopters
around back to the devastation to see
what had happened behind them this is
terrible this is war zone terrible the
choppers arrived on the scene within
minutes in some cases beating the
rescuers who were rushing there they
were able to show people literally
digging out of the rubble they were able
to show other people rushing toward the
schools that had been damaged their
images from a few thousand feet above
were largely responsible for the
collective sense of shock that the
nation felt by dinnertime that shock may
have already started to wear off as the
national media lines up in front of
destroyed homes in interviews many of
the same people shows many of the same
scenes there will inevitably be
complaints about oversaturation of
coverage but it will be the local
reporters the first responder reporters
whose images will be the ones that are
remembered right now it's crossing
Bryant and 12 Street
